question.title: SP-API Feed Upload Error InvalidBucketName
question.body:
I'm trying to upload a json feed. I get the AccessToken and call createFeedDocument successfully, getting the FeedDocumentID and url to upload to. After solving the Signature Doesn't Match problem, I get a 400 error with an InvalidBucketName message trying to upload the feed document.

The bucket to upload the feed to is part of the url I get back from the createFeedDocument call so I don't understand why it is invalid. I've tried adding additional headers for x-amz-access-token, X-Amz-Credential, X-Amz-Signature, etc...

Originally written in Salesforce APEX, but I've tried Java and PostMan, all get the same error. No help from Amazon Selling Partner-API support.

For reference, the URL is:

https://tortuga-prod-na.s3-external-1.amazonaws.com/e2079312-a9e4-4b15-a6b2-a06928400cfd.amzn1.tortuga.4.na.T37NX6QDNXETEU?X-Amz-Algorithm=AWS4-HMAC-SHA256&X-Amz-Date=20250409T210023Z&X-Amz-SignedHeaders=content-type%3Bhost&X-Amz-Expires=Credential=Signature= The response body is:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<Error>
    <Code>InvalidBucketName</Code>
    <Message>The specified bucket is not valid.</Message>
    <BucketName>tortuga-prod-na.s3-external-1.amazonaws.com/e2079312-a9e4-4b15-a6b2-a06928400cfd.amzn1.tortuga.4.na.t37nx6qdnxeteu</BucketName>
    <RequestId>JV2P7VFT0QK10RW5</RequestId>
    <HostId>LdBRq/msy0XAeGSjqw/srJxAGgM9PVQJRbLW5tg6XSGI4vYiYJwbecXlyICaFuXBh6t4yJB/o0A=</HostId>
</Error>

The bucket name that the response says is invalid matches (except for case) the one specified in the url.

Has anyone else had this problem? Does anyone know the solution ?

question_comments.body: The URL looks similar to what is shown on Feeds API v2021-06-30 Use Case Guide, but the bucket name in the error message certainly looks invalid. It is more likely to be just tortuga-prod-na.
